text: <@U07AUPWN16Z> thanks for the feedback!  apps like data sync, but really any other 'built by HubSpot' app like the Google Calendar integration, Zoom, Salesforce sync, Linkedin Ads, ... they are all using very custom interfaces because they're not conceived as developer apps but are basically a piece of HubSpot packaged as an app.

Hi <@U01JT537HG9> So if one wanted to build their own sync app we would need to build all the custom settings for that sync inside the app web pages and control everything from the app itself and not try and build it into HubSpot.  I have thought about working on a sync app for a client but I have not yet tackled it.

I guess some of that depends on what the sync app does - is it to sync HubSpot with another SaaS platform?
take Salesloft for example: they have their own sync setting<https://help.salesloft.com/s/article/HubSpot-Admin-Guide?language=en_US|s inside of their own app>. while there's no settings whatsoever to control inside of HubSpot, they are extremely complete in their offering on their own 'app side'

Yes I would want to sync data from another platform with HubSpot - I build my apps with NodeJs and Express and I would set up scheduled tasks inside the app to perform the sync operations.  This would be a private app, not marketplace so the sync settings would be just for me or maybe one client user.  The SaaS is very much a niche application that the client currently uses and would want information brought into deals automatically.

Hi <@U01JT537HG9>,
Thank you for the explanations.
I did some research on the community and Slack and found numerous posts on the issue. Developers highly request more extensive customization options in the settings, so I recommend taking this seriously.

From our side, I can tell you that we develop integrations on various platforms. We are encountering several difficulties with HubSpot due to the lack of some (basic) customization options and extension points that are available on other platforms.

Hi Devs,
Need your help,
can someone suggest how can i get all records of custom objects using API?

You can read custom objects by using the list api. It returns response in pagination. So you will need to traverse through pages.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>

<@U07AUPWN16Z> <@U079H0S4PNY> I product manage extensibility, specifically the UI extensions side, and I want to dig into your use cases for App settings extensions, and extension points. I can hop onto a 15 min call, but after 10 days. Feel free to schedule <http://meetings.HubSpot.com/sparikh1|meetings.HubSpot.com/sparikh1>
Hi! Do we need an API in order to get omnisend data(email marketing) to HubSpot? I can see a section "email provider" but only MailChimp is available and no Omnisend App is avaialble

Hi I am new to HubSpot and when i tried to create sandbox environment in local it ask for production account. When i tried to access my production account with personal access key in browser it shows as "You do not have access to personal access key". Due to this i could not add my production account as default in CLI for creating sandbox environment any help will be great. Thanks in advance
